channel.title: Blog on Cyb10101
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Cyb10101

item.title: File Sharing
item.description: Transferring files to a partner (recipient) is basically pretty easy. Most of the time, only this has to be considered: Which medium: Via software or hardware Which file format: Pack in archive, split or send directly What security requirements: Password, encryption External hard drives, USB sticks or disks (CD, DVD, Bluray) are available for transfer via hardware. For the transfer via software, the internet is mostly used. By the way, my personal favorite for sending files is the Croc program.

item.title: Bitwarden to printer
item.description: Converts a JSON export from Bitwarden into a printable document. Bitwarden JSON: Print

item.title: Password manager
item.description: Password manager I would recommend Bitwarden and it would be best to also use an authenticator. Bitwarden (Free/Premium) LastPass (Free/Premium) KeePass (Free) Authenticator Authy or Google mostly suitable for the first access. Bitwarden Authenticator (TOTP) is only available for Premium. Authy (Free) Google Authentificator (Free) LastPass Authentificator (Free) Bitwarden Authenticator (TOTP) (Premium) Switching off the password manager in Firefox Firefox > Settings > Privacy & Security > Credentials and Passwords
